meanings.definition: Situated or occurring on the transmitting end of a nerve cell
meanings.sent1: The presynaptic neuron sends signals to the next cell.
meanings.sent2: The presynaptic terminal is where the nerve impulse starts.
meanings.sent3: The presynaptic side of the neuron always leads the way.
meanings.sent4: Her leadership style can be described as presynaptic, always initiating action.
meanings.sent5: The presynaptic location is like the starting point of a race, setting off the signal.

meanings.definition: Relating to the release of neurotransmitters from a nerve cell before the synaptic cleft
meanings.sent1: The presynaptic vesicles contain neurotransmitters ready for release.
meanings.sent2: Presynaptic events trigger the communication between nerve cells.
meanings.sent3: The presynaptic dance of neurotransmitter release is quite coordinated.
meanings.sent4: His words were like presynaptic signals, preparing everyone for what was to come.
meanings.sent5: The presynaptic process is like a messenger delivering important information.
